head.title: Brooklyn Union And Enron in Pact

hedline.hl1: Brooklyn Union And Enron in Pact

block.p: LEAD: The Brooklyn Union Gas Company said it had signed a long-term agreement with the Enron Gas Marketing Inc. unit of the Enron Corporation of Houston for more than 230 billion cubic feet of natural gas, or about 25 percent of the company's gas supply. Craig G. Matthews, Brooklyn Union's chief financial officer, said the gas could serve up to 125,000 of its 1.1 million customers in Brooklyn, Queens and Staten

LEAD: The Brooklyn Union Gas Company said it had signed a long-term agreement with the Enron Gas Marketing Inc. unit of the Enron Corporation of Houston for more than 230 billion cubic feet of natural gas, or about 25 percent of the company's gas supply. Craig G. Matthews, Brooklyn Union's chief financial officer, said the gas could serve up to 125,000 of its 1.1 million customers in Brooklyn, Queens and Staten

The Brooklyn Union Gas Company said it had signed a long-term agreement with the Enron Gas Marketing Inc. unit of the Enron Corporation of Houston for more than 230 billion cubic feet of natural gas, or about 25 percent of the company's gas supply. Craig G. Matthews, Brooklyn Union's chief financial officer, said the gas could serve up to 125,000 of its 1.1 million customers in Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island.

The Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Corporation of Houston will continue to be Brooklyn Union's major gas supplier, Mr. Matthews said. The Enron gas also will be transported to the area through Transcontinental's pipeline, he said. Mr. Matthews declined to specify the value or length of the agreeement.
